paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses variants in the TTR gene associated with transthyretin cardiac amyloidosis (ATTR-CA), specifically focusing on the Val122Ile mutation and its implications for penetrance and clinical presentation.

patients.demographics: Mean age 78.1 years, 91.1% male, 80.7% White, 14.6% African American
patients.phenotype: ATTR-CA with various heart failure phenotypes

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile mutation is the most frequently identified mutation in patients with hereditary ATTR.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the prevalence of the Val122Ile mutation among patients with hereditary ATTR.
key_quotes: Among patients with hATTR with available data on their genotype (n = 40), the most frequently identified mutation was Val122Ile (67.5%).

patients.demographics: Mean age 78.1 years, 91.1% male, 80.7% White, 14.6% African American
patients.phenotype: ATTR-CA with various heart failure phenotypes

functional_data.summary: The Thr60Ala mutation is one of the identified mutations in patients with hereditary ATTR.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the prevalence of the Thr60Ala mutation among patients with hereditary ATTR.
key_quotes: Among patients with hATTR with available data on their genotype (n = 40), the most frequently identified mutation was Val122Ile (67.5%), followed by Thr60Ala (20%).

patients.demographics: Mean age 78.1 years, 91.1% male, 80.7% White, 14.6% African American
patients.phenotype: ATTR-CA with various heart failure phenotypes

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation is one of the identified mutations in patients with hereditary ATTR.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the prevalence of the Val30Met mutation among patients with hereditary ATTR.
key_quotes: Among patients with hATTR with available data on their genotype (n = 40), the most frequently identified mutation was Val122Ile (67.5%), followed by Thr60Ala (20%) and Val30Met (5%).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant variants in the TTR gene were extracted successfully.
